alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 1:59PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Accumulating Snow in the Mountains Wednesday and Thursday... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Accumulations of more than 6 inches of snow look increasingly possible. * WHERE...Initially the Teton Range, but the heaviest snow is likely to shift to the mountains east of the Continental Divide. This area includes the Bighorn, Absaroka, and Wind River Ranges, especially east-facing slopes. Casper Mountain will also be impacted. * WHEN...The heaviest snow is expected to fall between sunset Wednesday and sunset Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hunters and others heading into the backcountry should prepare for wet and cold conditions. Heavy, wet snow could make for difficult travel on unpaved mountain roads, especially above 8000 feet.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West
